Pre-Game Insights: The Chicago Bulls got throttled by the Houston Rockets on Sunday and now have to turn around and travel to see the surprisingly solid Detroit Pistons.
Those Rockets travel to Milwaukee to face a Bucks team that may be struggling, but is still led by a superstar in Giannis Antetokounmpo, who may just drop 50 or a triple-double in any given game.
The last time the Atlanta Hawks and Sacramento Kings faced off, Trae Young and De'Aaron Fox combined for 56 points and 15 assists.
Over his last two games, Fox has scored 109 points -- by himself!!! This seems like a game where fireworks could happen.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Chicago Bulls got throttled by the Houston Rockets on Sunday.
The Rockets travel to Milwaukee to face the Bucks.
The Atlanta Hawks and Sacramento Kings faced off last time and combined for 56 points and 15 assists.
De'Aaron Fox has scored 109 points in his last two games.
Others: Jared McCain is in the midst of a scoring explosion that is seeing him soar to the top of the NBA Rookie of the Year race.
Malik Beasley has his shot working these days, and has stepped in as the starting shooting guard for the Pistons with Tim Hardaway Jr. (hand) out.
Onyeka Okongwu is in the midst of another surge, with back-to-back double-doubles and averages of 13.0 PPG, 10.0 RPG, 1.3 BPG and 1.3 SPG in 28.3 MPG coming off the bench over his past three outings.
Snellings' bets for the day include Jared McCain over 20.5 points (-125), De'Aaron Fox over 33.5 points (-110), and Cade Cunningham over 6.5 rebounds (-120).
